context.arch.enactor
Class EnactorReference

java.lang.Object
  context.arch.enactor.EnactorReference
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClassifierEnactorReference, HmmEnactorReference
public class EnactorReference
extends java.lang.Object

Fully describes a widget via a set of attributes, and a set of conditions on those attributes. Any attribute conditioned on should be represented in Attributes. TODO: enforce data correspondence, possible change over to collections. Added outcome field to specify what is the outcome when the rule is satisfied.

evaluateComponent

public void evaluateComponent(EnactorComponentInfo eci)
This method is called when a new batch of state data concerning a widget should be evaluated by this EnactorReference. Called to notify listeners.

Parameters:
widgetSubId - the unique identifier for the widget subscription
widgetState - the current state of the widget

conditionSatisfied

public void conditionSatisfied(EnactorComponentInfo eci)
Does some default tasks that are common for Enactors. Namely extract the event timestamp and save it into the data widget.

Parameters:
eci - sent from changes in the input Widget

conditionSatisfied

protected Attributes conditionSatisfied(ComponentDescription inWidgetState,
                                        Attributes outAtts)
Subclasses implement this to help build and return a data entity. Other tasks can also be done, such as generating explanations.

Parameters:
inWidgetState -
outAtts - out-widget attributes with some attributes already set (e.g. timestamp)
originalTimestamp -
Returns:

componentAdded

public void componentAdded(EnactorComponentInfo eci)
Called whenever a widget satisfies the EnactorReference descriptionQuery. A call to this method is advance notice that evaluateWidget will be called with this widgetSubId. A EnactorReference may override this method to provide more custom parameter Attributes to be set up by the Enactor, if unsure just leave the third arg null.

Parameters:
widgetSubId -

componentRemoved

public void componentRemoved(EnactorComponentInfo eci)
Called whenever a widget no longer satisfies the descriptionQuery.

Parameters:
widgetSubId -
